website_summaries.verdict: A fine choice for the occasional quick bowl of soup or tea, but limited space under the dispenser may leave you disappointed.
pros: An appealing choice for the budget-conscious consumer seeking a pot that rapidly heats up water
cons: There isn't quite enough space to fit a coffee mug under the dispenser

customer_reviews.title: I was very happy w quality and how fast it heats water
customer_reviews.text: I have the same which I bought years ago...I was very happy w quality and how fast it heats water..so I decided to get one for my office too ... but this one was one was defective unit (or the quality has gone down !) ...Release button broke in week one (the button was having troubling opening up the water drain, then it broke).. I don't know if amazon merchants replace defective units though (would be been the case from any other brick n mortar store :(
customer_reviews.author: LWHNirvana

customer_reviews.title: Flimsy design compared to older version
customer_reviews.text: Update: it broke. The lever to dispense the water broke off. Upon closer inspection the hinge attached to the lever broke on both sides. The hinge was made of soft plastic. Very disappointed. Interestingly my parent's older model with the one piece design is still working. Joint between base and upper rank seems weak. Upon depressing the button to fill the mug it bends forward. The older model was a one piece and felt more stable. I don't anticipate this version to last very long.
customer_reviews.author: Prime Member

customer_reviews.title: NOT THE HOT SHOT I LOVED
customer_reviews.text: I have used Hot Shots for many years. Every new model is flimsier than the previous model. I was so disappointed in this latest model, I returned it same day. Every part of this item is very cheap quality and it seems like whatever part you touch is so thin and fragile, one can't help but to think it will break. Additionally, I like a mug of coffee in the morning, but only a very small cup will fit. They have destroyed what was once a great product. It is sad to see such greed in the manufacturing process.
customer_reviews.author: Marty Segal

customer_reviews.title: Cheap plastic parts make this affordable hot water maker bottom of the list!
customer_reviews.text: How are there so many of these available, and at different price points? They all look the same, but come with a different bowl, mug, or cup. Naturally I ordered the least expensive. Inside of a month, the connector between the hot water area and the dispensing handle separated several times. Inside of a year, the dispenser handle snapped off entirely. Save your money and go with something a little more expensive that is designed to work for a while.
customer_reviews.author: Delphine

customer_reviews.title: Should have heeded other reviews:this thing is crap!
customer_reviews.text: Like many other reviewers, we had an old version of this product that worked well for years. This new version looks the same but the amount of force required to depress the lever that releases water is insane. It takes so much pressure that you can actually feel the cheap plastic lever bending. Even then, the water just trickles out so you have to keep pressure on the lever for a long time. This is junk and I'm returning it.
customer_reviews.author: JR

customer_reviews.title: It does not live up to the reputation of the original
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this as a replacement for one we had for years. This one lasted a very short time before it broke. The lid never stayed on and the dispense button is made of cheap plastic and broke after several weeks. What a shame as we loved the old one and this one was a HUGE disappointment. I am now in the market for a replacement and will not be purchasing this model. How I wish they stayed with the old design that had quality parts and actually worked as promised.
customer_reviews.author: Lilly Belle

customer_reviews.title: They don't make 'em like they used to....
customer_reviews.text: We've owned several hot-shots. They typically last a couple of years, so eventually the dispenser tab wears out. We've happily replaced them, as we've enjoyed the speed and convenience. Not any more. We bought one a few months ago that just didn't work. It's replacement lasted 2 months before the dispenser broke. Both newer units dispensed very slowly and over-heated the water. Unfortunately, we're outside the return window, so this one's going in the trash. We'll have to find another product, as this one is no longer of interest. Save your money.
customer_reviews.author: Alice_1950

customer_reviews.title: The water dispensing is flawed
customer_reviews.text: This is the third Sunbeam Hot Shot Water dispensers I've owned. This product has been a favorite of mine because it last and the water is HOT. Saying that, I am disappointed with this one. The button you press to extract the hot water from the basin takes a lot of pressure to lift the release valve inside the well. Then the water just trickles out. I have kept it thinking that this process might loosen up over time, but that has not been the case. The water is still HOT, so patience is now the key to enjoying it.
customer_reviews.author: Laura Evans

customer_reviews.title: Nice looking but it has functionality issues.
customer_reviews.text: This is the third generation that I have had of this appliance. Other than maybe styling each new one has been a disappointment. This one - a lot of pressure has to be applied to both the button to activate it and the lever to dispense the water. So much so that the device actually flexs considerable. Have to wait a long time for it to cool off before you can use it a second time.
customer_reviews.author: Chuck

customer_reviews.title: Junk
customer_reviews.text: It's junk. You fill the reservoir, it heats up the water. Then, you dispense it. Broke within a couple weeks, just like all the other reviews. Better to just buy one of those electric carafes that heat up water and pour it out. I thought it immediately dispensed hot water, but you must wait for it to be heated anyways. Lame.
customer_reviews.author: Joe

customer_reviews.title: A major design failure!
customer_reviews.text: I am using this product for many years (Perhaps over 5 years). It would get old and needed replacement after 2 or 3 years. However, unit that I purchased from AMAZON started falling apart after few weeks. I struggled with failing machine for few weeks but then I had to give up. I am including 4 photographs to show you what and how the product failed, no question that the latest design is a disaster! This is an embarrassment for the manufacturer as well as for AMAZON!!! I do have over 20 years product assurance engineering experience for a major corporation and find this product a text book failure. DBG
customer_reviews.author: El Supremo Grande

customer_reviews.title: Not as happy as with past Hotshots
customer_reviews.text: I really enjoy the quick and easy way of heating water for tea. However, this unit has very hard to push the start button. Normally taking more than one push to start. Also on this unit the water dispenser lever takes at least two fingers to slowly let the water out. I now start the count down on brewing my tea during the dispensing of water. Past units have not had these problems.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: SunBeam should go back to their old two button design with room for a cup (with a handle)
customer_reviews.text: I love the old Sunbeam HotShot. I bought a new one. The dispenser button on the first one didn't work. I returned it. The second HotShot arrived and the dispenser button works with great difficulty. I decided to keep it. Every time I use it, I worry that the dispenser button will break. It is so stiff. Also, the new design does not allow clearance for most cups to fit into it. PLEASE, Sunbeam, go back to the old wonderful design.
customer_reviews.author: Linda H

customer_reviews.title: Dispenser button broke after 2 weeks.
customer_reviews.text: I had a hot shot for 20 years before it broke. I replaced it with this item. Big mistake. Within two weeks the dispenser button popped off and could not be put back on. I returned it the next day.
customer_reviews.author: jodylync

customer_reviews.title: Sunbeam lost a customer
customer_reviews.text: I have been using this product for years and loved it! In the past 20 years, I've only replaced it 2-3 times and have used it sometimes up to 8 times a day. The last one had an issue with the water release, so I bought a new one...same issue and this on is only a month old. The water takes forever to dispense and the release lever feels like it is ready to break off. Bad design. I am breaking ties with this product. Thanks for the memories!
customer_reviews.author: Mary Beth Connor

customer_reviews.title: ) and I've always liked them. Bought this one for work and the ...
customer_reviews.text: I owned about 8 of these (we make a lot of tea!) and I've always liked them. Bought this one for work and the first time I used it the lid came off in my hand when I propped it back. It went back on easy enough but that shouldn't happen. All in all, it does what it was purchased to do.
customer_reviews.author: Margie McCurdy

customer_reviews.title: I will say that this thing gets used 2-5 times a day and it works great, as for leaks
customer_reviews.text: I've had Hot Shots for years, but have not had one for a while. I hesitated because many reviewers said this was cheap and it leaked. I will say that this thing gets used 2-5 times a day and it works great, as for leaks, I have not encountered one yet. I'm sure at some point it will dribble but if it's like my old ones you can let the dispenser button slam back vs letting off gently and it will fix itself.
customer_reviews.author: zozo

customer_reviews.title: Great Appliance
customer_reviews.text: For those who want to brew tea or drink instant coffee, this little appliance is wonderful. It is easy to use and easy to care for. It heats the water very quickly, and unlike a microwave, you don't have to wonder how long to put it in to get the water to boiling. We make sure we prop the lid open to let it dry when we are done using it. It is meant to be used with just water (washing out the water well would be very difficult to do without ruining the electrical appliance...). We've used these for years, and really appreciate how handy this appliance is, and how little room it takes up on the counter.
customer_reviews.author: Susan L. Stone

customer_reviews.title: " Sunbeam" has "value engineered" this product into oblivion Totally disappointed.
customer_reviews.text: Do Not Buy! Our original model Hotshot lasted us more than a decade of daily use, this flimsy new model version barely made 3 weeks before the dispensing tab broke completely off. It's all very poorly designed from too light a weight materials, " Sunbeam" has "value engineered" this product into oblivion Totally disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Snurrbart

customer_reviews.title: New design (new to me)
customer_reviews.text: I replaced a very old Hot Shot. I have found I like the old design better. The lever to dispense the water pushes down hard and actually makes the top of the Hot Shot bend forward. I have now been reading reviews that the lever often breaks off.
customer_reviews.author: Brenda

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I have used Hot Shot Hot water dispensers since in the seventies and have gotten good service from them. The first one lasted approximately 20 years. The second one 10 years. I ordered one in February 2020. The dispenser did not work properly. I finally got it to slowly dispense the water. Then the dispenser button fell off and the lid will not stay on. It heats fine; however e, I have to risk burning my hand to pour water out of it. For the first time since I have been using this brand of dispenser, I am disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Eva E.

customer_reviews.title: For some reason, my son loves the red bowl that comes with the dispenser
customer_reviews.text: This item is replacing my really really old "Hot Shot" water dispenser, which still heated up the water but the dispenser lever broke making it unusable. This dispenser has a larger foot print than the old model I had. I dropped one star for three reasons: 1) it take about 30% longer to heat the water than my old model 2) The water is slower coming out of the dispenser hole 3) not too keen on having the switch in the back of the machine.
customer_reviews.author: D. Neeley

customer_reviews.title: Holds 12 once cup nicely
customer_reviews.text: It holds Costco 12 once cup very well. The tank looked small but I poured and 1-1/2 cup of 12 once and it could easily fit. It boiled the water (not just warmed) in exact two minutes while brand new. I had filled it so water poured out after 2 min. It does make simmering noise as if water is boiled. Everything is great, but it is not stylish. Not for stylish people. Please check my uploaded image where it shows 12 once up placed inside. "Large" mugs may not fit but regular mugs will. Important: Never turn this unit on if there is no water in its tank. It can easily get damaged. That's what the instruction says.
customer_reviews.author: H Khan

customer_reviews.title: Broke easliy with daily use
customer_reviews.text: I really loved using it, until it broke. The lever to release the water broke off easily after only a month of gentle daily use in the morning. So great idea but poorly made.
customer_reviews.author: VAndyland

customer_reviews.title: Heats water to boiling quickly. Having the "On" button ...
customer_reviews.text: Heats water to boiling quickly. Having the "On" button on the top rather than right next to the "Dispense" button (they were right next to each other on an older model) is a plus because it reduces the chance of accidentally hitting the wrong button at the wrong time. On the down side. the spring on the "Dispense" button is very stiff and broke after 6 months of two or three times a day use. We only bought a new model because the hinge on the lid of our very old Hot Shot broke.
customer_reviews.author: Charles G Groat

customer_reviews.title: CHEAPLY MADE
customer_reviews.text: I have owned one of these for over ten years and have been extremely happy with it. It was very durable. Just recently the plastic button broke off but it but it still worked fine. I decided to buy a new one. This one that I purchased is very cheaply made. The lid doesn't close all the way and is slightly crooked. The button to dispense the hot water has to be pushed down very hard or the water doesn't come out at all. I was very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Vinny

customer_reviews.title: Dispenser broke after 12 uses. :(
customer_reviews.text: I grew up with one of these and it’s a super handy appliance, but I’m disappointed that after only using this 12 times, the dispenser button broke completely. :/
customer_reviews.author: Hope

customer_reviews.title: My most used appliance
customer_reviews.text: Handy, efficient, fast water heater. Over 25 years I’ve had to replace this appliance when heating element overheats, not surprising as it is used for many times a day for 5 or 6 years! I now keep a replacement on hand as I never want to be without. I can’t imagine returning to boiling water on a stovetop.
customer_reviews.author: G Clem

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality and now broken water release handle/requesting refund
customer_reviews.text: This item was defective from day one. The lever that releases the water was always difficult and tight. Now the lever has actually broken off. I have owned a Sun Beam HOt SHot for decades and never had any problems like this. This is a very poor quality product and I am most disappointed that Amazon is selling it. Now I believe it is too late for a refund....Totally unacceptable product. I would like to request a refund from Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Cathleen Errett

customer_reviews.title: Lid raises with steam... careful!
customer_reviews.text: This is my 2nd hot shot water dispenser. I loved the first one... and after almost daily use for more than 5 years, it's life had to end. I replaced it with this one thinking it would be the same. It heats water well... but as it is heating the water the steam pushes the lid up because it is made of lighter weight plastic than it was before. I would still recommend it, but maybe not as highly as before. Keep your hands away from the lid while heating!
customer_reviews.author: Julie

customer_reviews.title: I thought it was pretty tenuous when we got it
customer_reviews.text: Bought this in May 2016; used it maybe, maybe 5 times since then. The little gray tab that dispenses the hot water broke off today. I thought it was pretty tenuous when we got it, but also thought it would last beyond such minimal use. Wrong. Of course it is beyond the return date to Amazon, and cannot find any help in returning it to Mr. Coffee. But I will contact them. Naomi - long time Prime Member
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great product but base is flimsy
customer_reviews.text: I have had a Sunbeam Hot Shot since the mid 80's and love it for my morning tea. This is my third one (the previous two each lasted over a decade!). And it really heats up the water. So from this point of view, it is fantastic. But my previous two were made from a hard plastic. This one the exterior is a soft plastic and has lots of give to it. But if you leave it in one place it probably will be fine. This comes with a nice ceramic bowl, probably for hot ceral. But I actually use it in the kitchen as a temporary holding bowl while cooking. So this is a great extra bonus!
customer_reviews.author: Movie Mania

customer_reviews.title: DON'T WASTE YOUR MONEY.
customer_reviews.text: I haven't even had this a month and IT BROKE!!! I had another Sunbeam one and that one lasted forever but this one was junk!!!! I'm so mad
customer_reviews.author: Diana

customer_reviews.title: ... years ago when I was first married and I loved it. I just purchased one for my daughter
customer_reviews.text: I bought one of these Hot Shots about thirty years ago when I was first married and I loved it. I just purchased one for my daughter. The water gets super hot so I would recommend caution to parents to keep this out of the reach of children. The one complaint I have is the fact that it should be a bit taller to fit taller mugs. There is very little room to dispense the water when using anything other than a regular size coffee cup. I still recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: bubba703mom

customer_reviews.title: Power house machine.
customer_reviews.text: It is the truth that this little power-house machine heats water faster than the microwave. I use it every day for heating water to cook something and to clean some stubborn grime off granite and tile. Fabulous. If anything happens to it, I will buy another one. My friend has had one for 20 years and thinks the Hot Shot is his favorite kitchen utensil. I agree.
customer_reviews.author: Tina Miller

customer_reviews.title: Usefull item
customer_reviews.text: I have had a few of these over the years and still own a working unit but ordered another while they are still available. This latest one has a new design that appears to be less sturdy than my older version. The body of the unit bends noticeably when you depress the spring-loaded dispense button. It has some improvements like a coating in the heating chamber and the power button is now located on top, not next to the dispense button like on the older unit. I still expect it to last. My last one failed from a broken thermostat switch inside. That was about 10 years ago.
customer_reviews.author: G. Miller

customer_reviews.title: Cheap, works ok, but it's not the original
customer_reviews.text: As everyone else mentioned, it's okay, but the buttons and dispenser are very cheap. This is not like the older model that is no longer sold, which was awesome.
customer_reviews.author: Paul C

customer_reviews.title: you could do a lot worse. This unit takes very little space
customer_reviews.text: I have a hot shot that is over 40 years old. Still use it. Bought the "new" one in case the old one quits. If you want hot water for cocoa or coffee or tea, you could do a lot worse. This unit takes very little space, fits into my office better than a microwave and works. Hot water very fast....
customer_reviews.author: D. H. HYATT

customer_reviews.title: Defective dispenser
customer_reviews.text: This is the second and last Hot shot I purchase from Sunbeam. It heats well but is useless without a dispenser which breaks down. This used to be a good product but lately the quality has been very disappointing. I now have a NEW broken machine because of the dispenser that I will have to discard. Very disappointed customer. AL
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for tea
customer_reviews.text: I love to drink hot tea. As most people, I used to boil water in a kettle. Although it did the trick, to get a cup of tea you had to wait until the entire volume of water in the kettle boiled, which wasted both time and electricity. This device solves both problems because it only boils the amount of water that you require for your cup of tea. Just pour the right amount of water inside, burn the switch on, wait about 15 seconds (that's how fast it works), and brew your tea. A must-have for hot-tea drinkers.
customer_reviews.author: Ilya

customer_reviews.title: Quality is very poor.
customer_reviews.text: I have purchased several Hot Shots over the years. They are inexpensive, so you get what you pay for. The quality has been going downhill lately. The lid keeps falling off and the water dispensing is very slow. I almost have to break the lever off to get water to come out. These things are junk. If I had known about the high quality hot water dispensers that are on the market I never would have wasted so much money on Hot Shots.
customer_reviews.author: H. E. Grogan

customer_reviews.title: defective item sent
customer_reviews.text: I have been using this product for about 20 years. So I had this one as a spare for when mine stopped working. The return window closed and I am getting zero support from Amazon. I have never had such terrible service from Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Maureen McGrath

customer_reviews.title: Feels cheaply made
customer_reviews.text: This product is made in china. The plastic feels cheaply made. I bought mine in 2011. To its credit, it is still functional.
customer_reviews.author: Thien Ooi

customer_reviews.title: Hot water quickly
customer_reviews.text: I like the fact that the water is heated quickly much faster that on the range.
customer_reviews.author: Terry T

customer_reviews.title: Improvements have been made
customer_reviews.text: Since I bought my first Hot Shot about 8 yrs ago. It is harder to accidentally press the heater button, especially is there is nothing in the heating well. There is more room under the dispenser to keep cups from accidentally falling out -- I usually leave the cup there after dispensing the water and it's comforting to know that I can't knock it over as easily as I could in the old model, The Hot Shot heats water FAST and HOT.
customer_reviews.author: BookAce

customer_reviews.title: A Great, Simple, Quick Water Heater for your Hot Drinks or anything you need it for.
customer_reviews.text: Its awesome because it works nice and easy, quick heating time and everything. Its a nice looking unit, does its job no problem. I don't have really any gripes, doesn't get 5 stars because its just a fine replacement to what we had, which was an older white sunbeam heater. There are times I can't tell if all the water is out, but that's not the fault of the machine.
customer_reviews.author: Andy Bon Stutterphen

customer_reviews.title: Seems to take a good 30 seconds to dispense a coffee mug's worth of ...
customer_reviews.text: Drains too slowly. I don't know why a bowl is included with this product; doesn't say where the bowl is made, so I can only guess that it's China and lead paint was used. The Hot Shot heats water quickly, but dispensing the water is too slow for my tastes. Seems to take a good 30 seconds to dispense a coffee mug's worth of water.
customer_reviews.author: Brandy

customer_reviews.title: So hot the best
customer_reviews.text: Would not want to be without it. The water gets hotter than my Kurig for tea or cocoa.
customer_reviews.author: joan

customer_reviews.title: Hot Shot
customer_reviews.text: I am EXTREMELY upset. I sent this Hot Shot to my elderly parents in Hawaii. Not only was the ceramic mug/bowl missing and no invoice to return with....the dispense thing is broken off! My parents cannot box it up to bring to the post office. MAJOR DISAPPOINTMENT. BTWit would not submit unless I selected the star ratings.
customer_reviews.author: islandgirl

customer_reviews.title: TIME SAVER
customer_reviews.text: Love it. Heats water up in seconds. I also use it to speed up boiling when cooking.
customer_reviews.author: judy

customer_reviews.title: Ease of use and hot water so quickly.
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this for my mother who’s older version brewed its last cup after many years of service. She was so happy that I was able to get her another. She uses it every day to make coffee or her oatmeal. It’s so easy to use and she especially loves the mug that came with it.
customer_reviews.author: DonnaD

customer_reviews.title: I have relied on Hot Shot for over a decade and am delighted to have a new one
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the Hot Shot as a replacement for an earlier model whose lid had finally given up the ghost. I have relied on Hot Shot for over a decade and am delighted to have a new one.The newer model's on/off switch is much better placed, and the assembly seems to work very well. My only concern is that the dispensing operation seems not to dispense the last bit of water without effort, but that is a minor inconvenience.
customer_reviews.author: Nanalou West Sauder

customer_reviews.title: Failed expectations
customer_reviews.text: mpaThis product failed my expectations. First one the dispense button failed to work within a week. The company was very good and sent a replacement right away. Then this immediately failed also. Then sent a different produce to replace. I haves hot shot for years not any more
customer_reviews.author: AmJoe Healyazon Customer

customer_reviews.text: Bought this for travel and it works perfectly. BUT not sure how it will holdup over time, when pushing down on the lever to dispense the water, the whole top (water well) feels as if it will snap off! Sad to say this died a few months after I wrote the original review.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: works for 8 oz mug or the bowl, but not for a 12 oz. mug
customer_reviews.text: Works, but as posted by others, a 12oz mug does not fit in it. I fill with the mug, but have to dispense into a measuring cup (that barely fits) and pour that into the mug. I also note that the drain is maybe a bit slower than the older model, but works fine and have had no leakage so far. Just baffled as to why the designers would take something perfect for a cup of tea, and CHANGE the design so it doesn't work for half the cups in the cupboard! It used to work, then they fixed it.
customer_reviews.author: Gregory W Howard

customer_reviews.title: Perfect hot water maker
customer_reviews.text: I needed something for work as they don't have a hot water faucet on the coffee maker at work. I am not allowed to keep things plugged in either. It stays in my drawer. I take it out, put water in it, it does make a little noise, which I cover up by rummaging around for my tea bags during that time. A minute later its piping hot. My large coffee cup just clears it, but that is all I needed. I'd buy it again in a heart beat.
customer_reviews.author: DIY Southern Woman of a Certain Age

customer_reviews.title: broke after  2 weeks
customer_reviews.text: i have been using the hot shots for over 25 years with some years of use before dying. not this one, 2 weeks and it broke beyond repair. naturally all boxing and paperwork destroyed as i never had this happen before. will think twice before buying again.
customer_reviews.author: virginia certo

customer_reviews.title: Weak dispenser b
customer_reviews.text: Lately the part you press down to dispense is very hard to do and when you put extra force it breaks after a few months. They need to do away with this trick for built in obscelence.
customer_reviews.author: Kausar Zafar

customer_reviews.title: Not as good as the older models
customer_reviews.text: I have used a Sunbeam Hotshot for many years but this one is not good. Too bad Sunbeam has lost their Quality Control. Difficult lever, slow dispensing, not as hot
customer_reviews.author: Jo-Ann Horner

customer_reviews.title: Should I return it for a replacement?
customer_reviews.text: The dispenser tab keeps falling off because you have to press so hard to dispense the water
customer_reviews.author: Roberta Harper

customer_reviews.title: Was in love until it broke
customer_reviews.text: I bought this and at first it was perfect. I would use it for my morning oatmeal and my morning tea. After less than a year of daily use, it stopped working. I pushed the power button and heard a weird noise and then nothing. Didn't hear the normal sound it made when it would heat up the water. So i am very sadden that i cant use it anymore. However, it was worth the money until it suddenly stopped working.
customer_reviews.author: Ms. Moody

customer_reviews.title: This is the second Hot Shot that has malfunctioned in ...
customer_reviews.text: This is the second Hot Shot that has malfunctioned in the past couple of years. They used to be so dependable but in order to save money in manufacturing they have really screwed it up.
customer_reviews.author: Earl

customer_reviews.title: Literally fell apart
customer_reviews.text: So this product worked for a few weeks until the grey buttons broke off an I had to throw it out. I really feel screwed over here. Stay far away from this product. It stinks! Waste of your money!
customer_reviews.author: Jay Rose

customer_reviews.title: It works great!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great little machine when you only need a cup of boiling water. Great for instant soups, hot chocolate, and instant coffee!
customer_reviews.author: MJC

customer_reviews.title: Design disaster
customer_reviews.text: My old Sunbeam dispenser started dripping after a decade of use so I purchased this dud... it drips even worse. If you lift the cover to refill it a second time hot water drips all over the place and the heating button is hard to depress and went out after a week. The only thing I like about this purchase is the porcelain bowl that came with it. Sunbeam blew it with this one.
customer_reviews.author: Stuart Osedo

customer_reviews.title: Terribly made
customer_reviews.text: We have been buying Sunbeam Hotshots for over 15 years and this is the first time we purchased one online. We have used each for many, many years until they finally give out from use. This Hotshot was not working properly within the first week. The lid repeatedly fell off when you opened the top and the dispense button was initially sticking and now is completely floppy and the unit cannot be used. Will be printing return ticket and sending it back. Would give zero stars if I could.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Did not perform as expected, water disperses slowly and ...
customer_reviews.text: Did not perform as expected, water disperses slowly and in intervals, in lieu of a steady stream. Dispersing button has to be pressed too far down, than should be expected. The previous generations of the Hot Shot performed admirably. Worthless
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: simple device to save time
customer_reviews.text: I recieved Sunbeam machine with red ceramic bowl today, and its a simple device to boil cup of water for coffee or soup, it does save time, at least 10 mnts as I usually boil my stainless steel kettle, but I noticed some water was left after dispersment, and the bowl gets very hot and cannot be touched by hands, now I am looking for the toffu soups online-I usually don't buy dry soups or instant oats.
customer_reviews.author: Lara Fish

customer_reviews.title: Not durable like they used to be
customer_reviews.text: I have had about 4 of these in the last 3 years. The reason I ordered it in the first place is because I had one that lasted 10 years and I never had a problem. Now they seem to be cheaply made, because after about 6 to 8 months of use, the plastic dispenser piece breaks off, and you have no way of getting the water to dispense. Won't buy another, due to this problem.
customer_reviews.author: Saved

customer_reviews.title: Sunbeams old hot shot is far superior to the new one.
customer_reviews.text: water does not dispense fully. the on button is hard to press down as is the dispense button. Stay away from this product.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley

customer_reviews.title: great product.  totally satisfied.
customer_reviews.text: It makes a great cup of hot water for anything. Coffee, tea, dehydrated food, oatmeal ect.
customer_reviews.author: Rich USA

customer_reviews.title: the best idea for college students
customer_reviews.text: I had bought one of these years ago for myself and purchased one for my oldest daughter two years ago from Bed Bath & Beyond for college and it was the hit of the floor (hot tea, hot cocoa, oatmeal). Hers along with this one I just purchased from Amazon (because BB&B didn't have them) came with a bowl which was nice for instant soups too. Heats up fast and with auto shut-off I feel that this little item is well worth the money. By the way, the one I purchased yrs ago is still working!! This item came within a few days and was delivered without any problems.
customer_reviews.author: collegemom

customer_reviews.title: Have loved the Hot Shot for year!
customer_reviews.text: I have loved the Hot Shot for years. I have just bought my third one (the old one still works and is being moved to the basement workshop). I also bought one as a gift since folks often comment on how "useful" and "fast" and "great" it is. The new size that allows for a bowl makes it just a little bit better. Great for instant cereals and big mugs.
customer_reviews.author: Cat

customer_reviews.title: Not even going to use
customer_reviews.text: You have to manually hold the handle down for the water which means instead of getting to multitask like I would with the microwave I have to stand there and hold the handle for a minute.
customer_reviews.author: Clare Campbell

customer_reviews.title: I love my hot shots
customer_reviews.text: I love my hot shots. I got this one for our cabin since I use the one in the house so much.
customer_reviews.author: Vicki

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend this product
customer_reviews.text: This is a great way to get a really hot cup of water in seconds. Much faster than a microwave. It is small and so easy to use. The cost is surprisingly minimal for the great job it does. Mine even came with a bowl. The only negative is that you cannot use a large mug with it because the large mug will not fit underneath. However, a standard mug works great.
customer_reviews.author: Carol Habas

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: We're on our 2nd or 3rd unit we're on, besides the ones we've given as gifts. It's much faster than a micro wave or a pot on the stove. We love it!
customer_reviews.author: Steven H. Newman

customer_reviews.title: Gets the water hot
customer_reviews.text: Warms the water quickly, however, you can only put a smaller cup under it. The bowl get very very hot so be careful if you use it. The part you push down to dispense the water came off. I was able to put it back on though.
customer_reviews.author: ES

customer_reviews.title: Although it works ok heating up water the dispenser handle ...
customer_reviews.text: Although it works ok heating up water the dispenser handle is cheaply made and has a tendency to wear out fast to the point of breaking off after only a short time of normal use. Not impressed with the quality/design of the water release handle.
customer_reviews.author: Greg Saucier

customer_reviews.title: Family and friends liked the concept So we bought more
customer_reviews.text: Got my 1st one about 20 yrs ago, still works. Changed appliance colors, bought different Color. Family and friends liked the concept So we bought more. They're perfect for a quick Coffee, hot chocolate, tea, instant oatmeal or Liptons cup-a-soup. Can't go wrong for the Price and convenience!
customer_reviews.author: ray szymanski

customer_reviews.title: Handy for Hot Beverages
customer_reviews.text: Trouble. Sunbeam must have switched suppliers. I had one that was great for a dozen years. Then, new one. #1: power switch stopped working. Ordered #2: after 2 weeks wouldn't dispense. Replaced by Amazon #3: lid kept falling off; after six days dispense lever fell off and wouldn't stay on. Conclusion: I think I'll try some other brand.
customer_reviews.author: Carl L. Stern

customer_reviews.title: Must-Have Appliance!
customer_reviews.text: You've got your toaster for sliced bread, and you've got to have a HOT SHOT for heating water. Works anywhere you can plug it in, and works fast-fast-fast! Simple to use, have one at home and get another for at work. Tea, hot chocolate, cup-a-soup, ramen, couscous, mashed potatoes.... what can you make with your Hot Shot?
customer_reviews.author: becs

customer_reviews.title: Love this.
customer_reviews.text: Love this.....had one years ago and thought they had discontinued them....ordered one immediately and use it every morning for my cup of tea and now it's cold for my hot chocolate!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Sandra Manring

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: This is actually the third one Our family has purchased because we used the other two to death. I love instant coffee and this gets used all day long. I am only disappointed when the electricity goes out. This is a great product in my opinion!
customer_reviews.author: luvsgadgets

customer_reviews.title: Leaked after two uses
customer_reviews.text: This thing lasted two uses before it began to leak. The mechanism that dispenses the water also stops the water from leaving the heating reservoir. The dispensing lever is made of plastic. After a few uses the lever deformed and the rubber stopper would no longer engage the opening. Save your money for something better.
customer_reviews.author: BashyMcNasty

customer_reviews.title: Classic Operation in Updated Packaging
customer_reviews.text: This is our 3rd dispenser in approx. 30 years of almost daily use. Not only used to heat water for tea/coffee but also the hot water is dispensed to warm food plates before dinner. Not sure as to the included red ceramic bowl. That bowl is now on the high shelf with all the other odd, never used, china.
customer_reviews.author: A Careful DIYer

customer_reviews.title: Works as advertised
customer_reviews.text: Heats my tea water quickly about a minute. Took two and a half minutes in a 1700 watt microwave. That saves me one and a half minutes per cup times five cups a day, seven and a half minutes times 365 days equals forty hours and thirty seven and a half minutes. I may get a part time job.
customer_reviews.author: Jim W

customer_reviews.title: Love this!
customer_reviews.text: I had one of these for about 11 years and it finally died on me the other week. I love having this appliance on the snack bar to use as hot water for tea. I highly recommend the Sunbeam. It's also handy for soups.
customer_reviews.author: Dianac

customer_reviews.title: Defective out of the box.
customer_reviews.text: The lid keeps falling off and the water dispenser barely opens. Very disappointed in Sunbeam quality. Would never buy a Sunbeam product again. Not worth the effort or price to return the product. I'll accept the loss as a learning experience.
customer_reviews.author: Neal Texeira

customer_reviews.title: loved it, bought three already
customer_reviews.text: loved it, bought three already, one for my house, another for the office and a third one as a gift
customer_reviews.author: Angel Elizondo

customer_reviews.title: Handy product
customer_reviews.text: It works well. The dispense lever is very cheap & the tank that holds the water does not quite empty entirely so you have to mop up some excess water to prevent long term damage to the heating vessel itself. The bowl that comes with it has a nice weight & i like how deep it is. For $20 it is a no-brainer for your teas, soups & oats at work.
customer_reviews.author: Shawn Ryan

customer_reviews.title: Really like the Hot Shot
customer_reviews.text: Really like the Hot Shot. However, when dispensing the water, it seems to dribble in different directions. This is my fourth Hot Shot in thirty years and the only one with this problem. I wore the other three out.
customer_reviews.author: j1019

customer_reviews.title: Best thing since sliced bread
customer_reviews.text: This little gadget works so good. Heats water so quickly with no mess or hassle. Love that you can fit a bowl under this model for making instant cereal / oatmeal. Great for college dorm rooms too. My daughter got a lot of use out of this for her cup o noodle and oatmeal.
customer_reviews.author: DeAnn Osborn

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Not what they used to be. Top does not stay connected. Have purchased these for over 40 years.
customer_reviews.author: Audrey Henry

customer_reviews.title: Broke after a month's use.
customer_reviews.text: Worked fine for a month, after that the dispense handle broke off from normal use. Now it's effectively useless since I can no longer dispense the hot water. And the return date was a week ago...
customer_reviews.author: Justice Schroeder

customer_reviews.title: Great prodcut!
customer_reviews.text: Bought for my 83 year old mother who loves this product and can't do with out !! Great prodcut !
customer_reviews.author: Rosealitta

customer_reviews.title: lever does not work good. you can't dispense water without a lot of ...
customer_reviews.text: never again. lever does not work good. you can't dispense water without a lot of force. not using it t anymore.
customer_reviews.author: Karen Foster

customer_reviews.title: Don't leave home without it!
customer_reviews.text: We've had one of these for many years now. Excellent product. Very handy for a quick cup of tea, or for dry soup mix, or hot cereal mix. Nice accessory to have in a hotel room when traveling. Wish they had a 12 volt model for a car! Great gift idea too.
customer_reviews.author: gunsmither

customer_reviews.title: The product leaks water frequently. We always keep a ...
customer_reviews.text: The product leaks water frequently. We always keep a measuring cup under the top and most mornings it is full of water.
customer_reviews.author: Wells

customer_reviews.title: quick and ez
customer_reviews.text: heats water in less than a minute. my old one lasted me over 10 years before finally giving up .. price went up but i'm sure over 10 years its worth every penny ..
customer_reviews.author: dan

product_meta.title: Sunbeam 6142 Hot Shot Hot Water Dispenser with Red Ceramic Bowl, White
product_meta.description: Sunbeam 6142 Hot Shot Hot Water Dispenser with Red Ceramic Bowl, White
feature_bullets: Heats 16 oz. of water faster than a microwave and auto shut off turns unit off immedialey after cycle is completed.
Cord storage fits neatly under the base.
Great for making instant soup, hot cereal and more.
Easy to use heat and dispense buttons.
Red Ceramic Bowl Included. NOTE: Refer user manual before use

specifications.Customer Reviews: 3.3 out of 5 stars522 ratings3.3 out of 5 stars
